articles.title: 100 mots allemands les plus courants
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Saviez-vous qu'en connaissant les 100 mots les plus courants d'une langue, vous pouvez comprendre environ 50% des textes ecrits ? Voici les 100 mots allemands essentiels, organises par categories pour faciliter votre apprentissage en couple.

## Pronoms personnels (10 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="ich, du, wir"
  translation="je, tu, nous"
  pronunciation="[ich, dou, vir]"
  example="Ich liebe dich. Wir sind zusammen."
/>

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| ich | je | [ich] |
| du | tu | [dou] |
| er | il | [√©r] |
| sie | elle / ils / elles | [zi] |
| es | il/ce (neutre) | [ess] |
| wir | nous | [vir] |
| ihr | vous (pluriel informel) | [ir] |
| Sie | vous (formel) | [zi] |
| man | on | [mann] |
| mich/dich | me/te | [mich/dich] |

<CultureTip title="Du vs Sie" flag="üá©üá™">
Le tutoiement (du) est reserve aux amis, a la famille et aux jeunes entre eux. Avec les inconnus et en contexte professionnel, utilisez "Sie". Avec votre partenaire, c'est bien sur "du" !
</CultureTip>

## Verbes essentiels (20 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="sein"
  translation="etre"
  pronunciation="[za√Øne]"
  example="Du bist wunderschon. "
/>

### Les 10 verbes les plus importants

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation | Exemple |
|----------|----------|---------------|---------|
| sein | etre | [za√Øne] | Ich **bin** glucklich |
| haben | avoir | [HA-beune] | Ich **habe** dich lieb |
| werden | devenir / futur | [V√àR-deune] | Du **wirst** meine Frau |
| konnen | pouvoir | [KEU-neune] | Ich **kann** nicht schlafen |
| mussen | devoir | [MU-seune] | Ich **muss** dich sehen |
| sagen | dire | [ZA-gueune] | **Sag** mir, dass du mich liebst |
| machen | faire | [MA-cheune] | Was **machst** du? |
| geben | donner | [GU√â-beune] | Ich **gebe** dir mein Herz |
| kommen | venir | [KO-meune] | **Kommst** du mit? |
| wollen | vouloir | [VO-leune] | Ich **will** dich sehen |

### 10 autres verbes courants

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| gehen | aller | [GU√â-eune] |
| sehen | voir | [Z√â-eune] |
| lassen | laisser | [LA-seune] |
| stehen | etre debout | [CHT√â-eune] |
| finden | trouver | [FIN-deune] |
| bleiben | rester | [BLA√è-beune] |
| lieben | aimer | [LI-beune] |
| nehmen | prendre | [N√â-meune] |
| wissen | savoir | [VI-seune] |
| denken | penser | [DEN-keune] |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Ich kann nicht aufhoren, an dich zu denken"
  translation="Je n'arrive pas a arreter de penser a toi"
  pronunciation="[ich kann nicht AOF-heu-reune ane dich tsou DEN-keune]"
  context="Une phrase romantique utilisant plusieurs verbes essentiels"
/>

## Articles et determinants (10 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="der, die, das"
  translation="le, la"
  pronunciation="[d√©r, di, dass]"
  example="Der Mann liebt die Frau."
/>

| Allemand | Francais | Usage |
|----------|----------|-------|
| der | le (masc.) | der Mann |
| die | la (fem.) / les | die Frau / die Leute |
| das | le (neutre) | das Kind |
| ein | un (masc./neutre) | ein Mann |
| eine | une | eine Frau |
| kein | aucun | kein Problem |
| mein | mon | mein Schatz |
| dein | ton | dein Herz |
| sein | son | sein Haus |
| ihr | son (f.) / leur | ihr Mann |

## Prepositions (10 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="mit dir"
  translation="avec toi"
  pronunciation="[mit dir]"
  example="Ich bin gern mit dir zusammen."
/>

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation | Exemple |
|----------|----------|---------------|---------|
| in | dans | [ine] | in meinem Herzen |
| mit | avec | [mit] | mit dir |
| zu | a, vers | [tsou] | zu dir |
| fur | pour | [fur] | fur dich |
| auf | sur | [aof] | auf dich |
| an | a, contre | [ane] | an dich denken |
| von | de | [fone] | von dir |
| nach | apres, vers | [nach] | nach Hause |
| bei | chez | [ba√Ø] | bei mir |
| aus | de, hors de | [aoss] | aus Liebe |

## Conjonctions et adverbes (15 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="immer"
  translation="toujours"
  pronunciation="[I-meur]"
  example="Ich werde dich immer lieben."
/>

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| und | et | [ount] |
| aber | mais | [A-beur] |
| oder | ou | [O-deur] |
| wenn | si, quand | [v√®ne] |
| weil | parce que | [va√Øl] |
| dass | que | [dass] |
| auch | aussi | [aoch] |
| nur | seulement | [nour] |
| noch | encore | [noch] |
| schon | deja | [chone] |
| sehr | tres | [z√©r] |
| immer | toujours | [I-meur] |
| nie | jamais | [ni] |
| so | si, ainsi | [zo] |
| dann | alors, puis | [dane] |

<CultureTip title="Und vs Aber" flag="üá©üá™">
"Und" (et) et "aber" (mais) ne changent pas l'ordre des mots, contrairement a "weil" (parce que) et "wenn" (si/quand) qui envoient le verbe a la fin de la proposition.
</CultureTip>

## Questions (7 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="warum"
  translation="pourquoi"
  pronunciation="[va-ROUM]"
  example="Warum liebst du mich?"
/>

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation | Exemple |
|----------|----------|---------------|---------|
| wer | qui | [v√©r] | Wer bist du? |
| was | quoi | [vass] | Was machst du? |
| wo | ou | [vo] | Wo bist du? |
| wann | quand | [vanne] | Wann kommst du? |
| warum | pourquoi | [va-ROUM] | Warum liebst du mich? |
| wie | comment | [vi] | Wie geht es dir? |
| welche(r) | quel(le) | [V√àL-cheu] | Welchen Film magst du? |

## Noms essentiels (15 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="die Liebe"
  translation="l'amour"
  pronunciation="[di LI-beu]"
  example="Die Liebe meines Lebens bist du."
/>

### Concepts abstraits

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| die Zeit | le temps | [di tsa√Øt] |
| das Leben | la vie | [dass L√â-beune] |
| die Liebe | l'amour | [di LI-beu] |
| das Gluck | le bonheur | [dass gluk] |
| der Tag | le jour | [d√©r tak] |

### Personnes

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| der Mann | l'homme | [d√©r mann] |
| die Frau | la femme | [di fraou] |
| das Kind | l'enfant | [dass kint] |
| der Freund | l'ami | [d√©r froent] |
| die Familie | la famille | [di fa-MI-li√©] |

### Lieux et objets

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| das Haus | la maison | [dass haoss] |
| die Welt | le monde | [di v√®lt] |
| das Herz | le coeur | [dass h√®rts] |
| die Hand | la main | [di hant] |
| das Auge | l'oeil | [dass AOU-gueu] |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Du bist mein Herz, mein Leben, meine Welt"
  translation="Tu es mon coeur, ma vie, mon monde"
  pronunciation="[dou bist ma√Øne h√®rts, ma√Øne L√â-beune, MA√è-neu v√®lt]"
  context="Une declaration utilisant plusieurs noms essentiels"
/>

## Adjectifs courants (10 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="schon"
  translation="beau/belle"
  pronunciation="[cheune]"
  example="Du bist so schon!"
/>

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation | Exemple |
|----------|----------|---------------|---------|
| gut | bon, bien | [gout] | Das ist gut |
| neu | nouveau | [noe] | ein neues Leben |
| gro√ü | grand | [gross] | eine gro√üe Liebe |
| klein | petit | [kla√Øne] | ein kleines Geschenk |
| schon | beau | [cheune] | Du bist schon |
| alt | vieux | [alt] | zusammen alt werden |
| lang | long | [lang] | eine lange Zeit |
| ganz | tout, entier | [gants] | mein ganzes Herz |
| eigen | propre | [A√è-gueune] | mein eigenes Gluck |
| andere | autre | [AN-deu-reu] | keine andere |

## Nombres de base (5 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="zwei"
  translation="deux"
  pronunciation="[tsva√Ø]"
  example="Wir zwei gehoren zusammen."
/>

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| eins | un | [a√Ønss] |
| zwei | deux | [tsva√Ø] |
| drei | trois | [dra√Ø] |
| hundert | cent | [HOUN-deurt] |
| tausend | mille | [TAO-zeunt] |

## Mots de liaison et expressions (8 mots)

<VocabCard
  word="ja / nein"
  translation="oui / non"
  pronunciation="[ya / na√Øne]"
  example="Ja, ich liebe dich!"
/>

| Allemand | Francais | Prononciation | Usage |
|----------|----------|---------------|-------|
| ja | oui | [ya] | Ja, naturlich! |
| nein | non | [na√Øne] | Nein, niemals! |
| nicht | ne...pas | [nicht] | Ich liebe dich nicht weniger |
| vielleicht | peut-etre | [fi-LA√èCHT] | Vielleicht morgen? |
| heute | aujourd'hui | [HOE-teu] | Heute ist unser Tag |
| hier | ici | [hir] | Hier bin ich |
| dort | la-bas | [dort] | Dort wartest du |
| jetzt | maintenant | [y√®tst] | Jetzt oder nie |

## Recapitulatif par frequence

Les 20 mots les plus utilises en allemand sont :
1. **der/die/das** (les articles)
2. **und** (et)
3. **sein** (etre)
4. **in** (dans)
5. **ein** (un)
6. **zu** (a, vers)
7. **haben** (avoir)
8. **ich** (je)
9. **werden** (devenir)
10. **sie** (elle/ils)
11. **von** (de)
12. **nicht** (ne...pas)
13. **mit** (avec)
14. **es** (ce/il)
15. **sich** (se)
16. **auch** (aussi)
17. **auf** (sur)
18. **fur** (pour)
19. **an** (a)
20. **er** (il)

<CultureTip title="Apprentissage efficace" flag="üá©üá™">
Apprenez ces 100 mots en contexte plutot qu'isolement. Creez des phrases avec votre partenaire en combinant plusieurs mots de cette liste. C'est plus efficace et plus amusant !
</CultureTip>

## Exercices pratiques pour couples

### Exercice 1 : Phrases combin√©es

Creez des phrases utilisant au moins 5 mots de la liste :

Exemple : **Ich** (je) **liebe** (aimer) **dich** (te) **sehr** (tres) **und** (et) **immer** (toujours)
‚Üí Ich liebe dich sehr und immer.

### Exercice 2 : Quiz a deux

Testez-vous mutuellement ! L'un dit un mot en francais, l'autre doit donner l'allemand et vice versa.

### Exercice 3 : Conversation avec les 100 mots

Essayez d'avoir une conversation de 5 minutes en n'utilisant que les mots de cette liste. C'est un defi amusant !

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Mit diesen Wortern kann ich dir sagen, dass ich dich liebe"
  translation="Avec ces mots, je peux te dire que je t'aime"
  pronunciation="[mit DI-zeune VEUR-teurne kann ich dir ZA-gueune dass ich dich LI-beu]"
  context="Meme avec un vocabulaire limite, l'essentiel peut etre exprime"
/>

## Tableau recapitulatif des 100 mots

### Pronoms (10)
ich, du, er, sie, es, wir, ihr, Sie, man, mich/dich

### Verbes (20)
sein, haben, werden, konnen, mussen, sagen, machen, geben, kommen, wollen, gehen, sehen, lassen, stehen, finden, bleiben, lieben, nehmen, wissen, denken

### Articles/Determinants (10)
der, die, das, ein, eine, kein, mein, dein, sein, ihr

### Prepositions (10)
in, mit, zu, fur, auf, an, von, nach, bei, aus

### Conjonctions/Adverbes (15)
und, aber, oder, wenn, weil, dass, auch, nur, noch, schon, sehr, immer, nie, so, dann

### Questions (7)
wer, was, wo, wann, warum, wie, welche(r)

### Noms (15)
die Zeit, das Leben, die Liebe, das Gluck, der Tag, der Mann, die Frau, das Kind, der Freund, die Familie, das Haus, die Welt, das Herz, die Hand, das Auge

### Adjectifs (10)
gut, neu, gro√ü, klein, schon, alt, lang, ganz, eigen, andere

### Nombres (5)
eins, zwei, drei, hundert, tausend

### Expressions (8)
ja, nein, nicht, vielleicht, heute, hier, dort, jetzt

## Prochaines etapes

Maintenant que vous connaissez ces 100 mots essentiels, pratiquez-les quotidiennement avec votre partenaire. La repetition est la cle ! Utilisez-les dans des contextes reels : messages, conversations, notes d'amour.

Ces 100 mots sont votre fondation - tout le reste viendra s'y ajouter naturellement.

<CTA text="Continuez a enrichir votre vocabulaire" buttonText="Prochaine lecon" />

articles.title: Hungarian for Couples: 75 Essential Phrases
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Learning Hungarian with your partner is one of the most romantic journeys you can take together. This unique language opens doors to deep conversations, inside jokes, and a closer connection with Hungarian culture. Here are 75 essential phrases that every couple learning Hungarian should master.

<PhraseOfDay
  hungarian="J√≥ reggelt, szerelmem"
  english="Good morning, my love"
  pronunciation="YOH REH-gelt SEH-rel-mem"
  context="The perfect way to start every day with your Hungarian-speaking partner."
/>

## Morning and Evening Greetings

Start and end each day with these sweet phrases:

<VocabCard
  hungarian="J√≥ reggelt, sz√≠vem"
  english="Good morning, my heart"
  pronunciation="YOH REH-gelt SEE-vem"
  example="J√≥ reggelt, sz√≠vem! Hogy aludt√°l?"
/>

| Hungarian | English | When to Use |
|-----------|---------|-------------|
| J√≥ reggelt, sz√≠vem | Good morning, my heart | Waking up together |
| J√≥ napot, dr√°g√°m | Good afternoon, my dear | Midday greeting |
| J√≥ est√©t, szerelmem | Good evening, my love | Evening greeting |
| J√≥ √©jszak√°t, kincsem | Good night, my treasure | Before sleep |
| Sz√©p √°lmokat | Sweet dreams | Bedtime wishes |
| √âbredj fel, napf√©nyem | Wake up, my sunshine | Gentle wake-up call |

<CultureTip title="The Hungarian Day" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Hungarians are quite specific about greetings. **J√≥ reggelt** (good morning) is used until about 9-10 AM, **j√≥ napot** (good day) until about 6 PM, and **j√≥ est√©t** (good evening) after that. Using the right greeting shows respect and cultural awareness.
</CultureTip>

## Expressing Love and Affection

These phrases let you express your feelings throughout the day:

<VocabCard
  hungarian="Szeretlek"
  english="I love you"
  pronunciation="SEH-ret-lek"
  example="Szeretlek, nagyon-nagyon."
/>

<VocabCard
  hungarian="Hi√°nyzol"
  english="I miss you"
  pronunciation="HEE-ahn-yozl"
  example="Hi√°nyzol, mikor j√∂ssz haza?"
/>

| Hungarian | English | Emotion Level |
|-----------|---------|---------------|
| Szeretlek | I love you | Deep love |
| Nagyon szeretlek | I love you very much | Intense love |
| Im√°dlak | I adore you | Worship-like love |
| Hi√°nyzol | I miss you | Longing |
| Nagyon hi√°nyzol | I miss you so much | Deep longing |
| Gondolok r√°d | I am thinking of you | Tender thoughts |
| Te vagy mindenem | You are my everything | Complete devotion |
| Boldog vagyok veled | I am happy with you | Contentment |

## Compliments and Appreciation

Make your partner feel special with these Hungarian compliments:

<VocabCard
  hungarian="Gy√∂ny√∂r≈± vagy"
  english="You are beautiful"
  pronunciation="DYUR-nyur-oo vahj"
  example="Gy√∂ny√∂r≈± vagy ma este."
/>

| Hungarian | English | Who It Fits |
|-----------|---------|-------------|
| Gy√∂ny√∂r≈± vagy | You are beautiful | For women |
| J√≥k√©p≈± vagy | You are handsome | For men |
| Csod√°latos vagy | You are wonderful | Anyone |
| Fantasztikus vagy | You are fantastic | Anyone |
| Okos vagy | You are smart | Intellectual compliment |
| Vicces vagy | You are funny | Personality compliment |
| Kedves vagy | You are kind | Character compliment |
| Sz√©p vagy | You are pretty/nice | General beauty |
| Szexi vagy | You are sexy | Intimate compliment |
| T√∂k√©letes vagy | You are perfect | Ultimate compliment |

<CultureTip title="Compliment Culture" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Hungarians can be modest about receiving compliments. Do not be surprised if your partner deflects praise with **"Ugyan m√°r"** (Oh, come on) or **"Nem is"** (Not really). Keep complimenting anyway - they secretly love it!
</CultureTip>

## Daily Life Together

These phrases help you navigate everyday life as a couple:

### Making Plans

<VocabCard
  hungarian="Mit csin√°lunk ma?"
  english="What are we doing today?"
  pronunciation="MIT chee-NAH-lunk mah"
  example="Mit csin√°lunk ma? Menj√ºnk s√©t√°lni?"
/>

| Hungarian | English | Situation |
|-----------|---------|-----------|
| Mit csin√°lunk ma? | What are we doing today? | Morning planning |
| Menj√ºnk valahova | Let's go somewhere | Suggesting an outing |
| Maradjunk itthon | Let's stay home | Cozy day in |
| Csin√°ljunk valamit egy√ºtt | Let's do something together | Quality time |
| Mikor j√∂ssz haza? | When are you coming home? | Waiting for partner |
| V√°rj meg! | Wait for me! | Being picked up |
| Gyere velem | Come with me | Invitation |
| Melyik filmet n√©zz√ºk? | Which movie shall we watch? | Movie night |

### At Home

| Hungarian | English | Context |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| √âhes vagyok | I am hungry | Food time |
| F≈ëz√∂k valamit | I will cook something | Meal prep |
| Egy√ºtt f≈ëzz√ºnk | Let's cook together | Couple cooking |
| F√°radt vagyok | I am tired | End of day |
| Gyere, fek√ºdj√ºnk le | Come, let's go to bed | Bedtime |
| √ñlelj meg | Hug me | Need comfort |
| Cs√≥kolj meg | Kiss me | Romantic moment |
| Fogd a kezem | Hold my hand | Walking together |

## Romantic Conversations

Deepen your connection with these romantic phrases:

<VocabCard
  hungarian="Veled akarom t√∂lteni az √©letem"
  english="I want to spend my life with you"
  pronunciation="VEH-led AH-kah-rom TUR-teh-nee ahz EH-leh-tem"
  example="Veled akarom t√∂lteni az √©letem, dr√°g√°m."
/>

| Hungarian | English | Depth |
|-----------|---------|-------|
| Veled akarom t√∂lteni az √©letem | I want to spend my life with you | Deep commitment |
| N√©lk√ºled nem tudok √©lni | I cannot live without you | Intense devotion |
| Te vagy az egyetlen | You are the only one | Exclusive love |
| Minden nap jobban szeretlek | I love you more every day | Growing love |
| √ñr√ºl√∂k, hogy megtal√°ltalak | I am glad I found you | Gratitude |
| Te teszed teljess√© az √©letem | You complete my life | Soul mate feeling |
| Mindig itt leszek neked | I will always be here for you | Promise |
| B√≠zom benned | I trust you | Deep trust |

<CultureTip title="Hungarian Romanticism" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Hungarians have a long tradition of romantic expression through poetry and song. Famous Hungarian love songs like **"Csak egy kisl√°ny van a vil√°gon"** (There is only one girl in the world) show how deeply Hungarians feel about love. Learning some lyrics can be incredibly romantic.
</CultureTip>

## Questions to Ask Your Partner

Keep conversations flowing with these questions:

| Hungarian | English | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| Hogy vagy? | How are you? | Daily check-in |
| J√≥l vagy? | Are you okay? | Showing concern |
| Mire gondolsz? | What are you thinking about? | Understanding them |
| Mi a v√©lem√©nyed? | What is your opinion? | Including them |
| Boldogg√° teszlek? | Do I make you happy? | Relationship check |
| Mit k√≠v√°nsz? | What do you wish? | Fulfilling desires |
| Mire van sz√ºks√©ged? | What do you need? | Caring question |
| √Ålmodt√°l valamit? | Did you dream something? | Morning question |

<VocabCard
  hungarian="Mire gondolsz?"
  english="What are you thinking about?"
  pronunciation="MEE-reh GON-dolsh"
  example="Mire gondolsz? Mes√©lj nekem."
/>

## Expressing Support and Care

Show your partner you are there for them:

| Hungarian | English | When to Use |
|-----------|---------|-------------|
| Melletted vagyok | I am by your side | Support during hard times |
| Sz√°m√≠thatsz r√°m | You can count on me | Offering reliability |
| B√ºszke vagyok r√°d | I am proud of you | Celebrating achievements |
| Seg√≠thetek? | Can I help? | Offering assistance |
| Minden rendben lesz | Everything will be okay | Reassurance |
| B√≠zz√°l bennem | Trust me | Building trust |
| Figyelek r√°d | I am paying attention to you | Active listening |
| T√°mogatlak | I support you | Unconditional support |

## Apologizing and Making Up

Every couple needs these phrases sometimes:

<VocabCard
  hungarian="Sajn√°lom"
  english="I am sorry"
  pronunciation="SHOY-nah-lom"
  example="Sajn√°lom, nem akartam megb√°ntani."
/>

| Hungarian | English | Level of Apology |
|-----------|---------|------------------|
| Sajn√°lom | I am sorry | Standard apology |
| Nagyon sajn√°lom | I am very sorry | Deeper apology |
| Bocs√°ss meg | Forgive me | Asking forgiveness |
| H√ºlye voltam | I was stupid | Admitting fault |
| Igazad volt | You were right | Accepting their position |
| Ne haragudj | Do not be angry | Calming request |
| Megbocs√°tasz? | Will you forgive me? | Seeking reconciliation |
| Soha t√∂bb√© | Never again | Promise to change |

<CultureTip title="The Hungarian Stubborn Streak" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Hungarians can be quite proud and stubborn. If your Hungarian partner struggles to apologize, know that it is often cultural. When they do say **sajn√°lom**, it really means something. Similarly, do not push too hard for an immediate apology - give them time to process.
</CultureTip>

## Sweet Nothings and Daily Romance

Little phrases that keep love alive:

| Hungarian | English | Perfect Moment |
|-----------|---------|----------------|
| Megcs√≥kolhatlak? | May I kiss you? | Romantic ask |
| Gyere k√∂zelebb | Come closer | Intimate moment |
| Szeretlek meg√∂lelni | I love hugging you | Cuddling |
| J√≥ melletted lenni | It is good to be with you | Contentment |
| Boldogg√° teszel | You make me happy | Gratitude |
| Nevetni szeretn√©k veled | I want to laugh with you | Playful |
| Mes√©lj valamit | Tell me something | Conversation starter |
| Hallgatlak | I am listening | Active attention |

## Quick Practice Conversations

### Morning Routine
**Partner A:** J√≥ reggelt, sz√≠vem! *(Good morning, my heart!)*
**Partner B:** J√≥ reggelt, dr√°g√°m. Hogy aludt√°l? *(Good morning, dear. How did you sleep?)*
**Partner A:** J√≥l. √âs te? *(Well. And you?)*
**Partner B:** Nagyon j√≥l, mert melletted voltam. *(Very well, because I was next to you.)*

### Evening Check-in
**Partner A:** Hogy telt a napod? *(How was your day?)*
**Partner B:** F√°raszt√≥ volt. *(It was tiring.)*
**Partner A:** Sajn√°lom, szerelmem. Pihenj√ºnk egy√ºtt. *(I'm sorry, my love. Let's rest together.)*
**Partner B:** Szeretlek. *(I love you.)*

### Making Plans
**Partner A:** Mit csin√°lunk a h√©tv√©g√©n? *(What are we doing this weekend?)*
**Partner B:** Menj√ºnk kir√°ndulni? *(Shall we go on a trip?)*
**Partner A:** Remek √∂tlet! *(Great idea!)*

## Quick Reference Card

| Situation | Key Phrase | Pronunciation |
|-----------|------------|---------------|
| Morning | J√≥ reggelt, sz√≠vem | YOH REH-gelt SEE-vem |
| Missing them | Hi√°nyzol | HEE-ahn-yozl |
| Love | Szeretlek | SEH-ret-lek |
| Compliment | Gy√∂ny√∂r≈± vagy | DYUR-nyur-oo vahj |
| Plans | Mit csin√°lunk? | MIT chee-NAH-lunk |
| Comfort | √ñlelj meg | UR-lely meg |
| Apology | Sajn√°lom | SHOY-nah-lom |
| Goodnight | J√≥ √©jszak√°t | YOH EH-sah-kaht |

Learning these phrases together with your partner creates shared memories and inside jokes that only you two understand. Every Hungarian phrase you master together strengthens your bond and shows your commitment to understanding each other's world.


<CTA
  text="Master Hungarian together with AI Voice Chat and Listen Mode for real-time transcription at family dinners. Track progress in Love Log and let your tutor create custom challenges."
  buttonText="Learn Hungarian Together"
/>

articles.title: √áiftler ƒ∞√ßin Portekizce: 25 Temel ƒ∞fade
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Portekizce √∂grenen bir cift olarak, g√ºnl√ºk hayatta kullanabileceginiz ifadeleri bilmek cok √∂nemlidir. Bu rehberde, sabahtan aksama kadar partnerinizle kullanabileceginiz temel Portekizce ifadeleri bulacaksiniz.

## Sabah Ifadeleri

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Bom dia, meu amor"
  translation="G√ºnaydƒ±n, askim"
  pronunciation="bom di-a, me-u a-mor"
  context="Her g√ºne bu g√ºzel selamlamayla baslayin"
/>

### Sabah Rutini Icin

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Como voc√™ dormiu?** | ko-mu vo-se dor-mi-u | Nasil uyudun? |
| **Dormi bem, obrigado/a** | dor-mi bem, ob-ri-ga-du/a | Iyi uyudum, tesekk√ºrler |
| **Est√° com fome?** | is-ta kom fo-me | Ac misin? |
| **Vou fazer o caf√©** | vo fa-zer u ka-fe | Kahve yapiyorum |
| **Tenha um bom dia!** | te-nya um bom di-a | Iyi g√ºnler! |

<VocabCard
  word="Preparei o caf√© da manh√£ para voc√™"
  translation="Sana kahvalti hazirladim"
  pronunciation="pre-pa-rey u ka-fe da ma-ny√£ pa-ra vo-se"
  example="Surpresa! Preparei o caf√© da manh√£ na cama."
/>

## Sevgi ve Ilgi Ifadeleri

### G√ºnl√ºk Sevgi S√∂zc√ºkleri

<VocabCard
  word="Te amo muito"
  translation="Seni cok seviyorum"
  pronunciation="te a-mu muy-tu"
  example="Voc√™ sabe que te amo muito?"
/>

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Eu te amo** | e-u te a-mu | Seni seviyorum |
| **Sinto sua falta** | sin-tu su-a fal-ta | Seni √∂zledim |
| **Penso em voc√™ sempre** | pen-su em vo-se sem-pre | Hep seni d√ºs√ºn√ºyorum |
| **Voc√™ √© lindo/a** | vo-se e lin-du/a | Cok g√ºzelsin |
| **Eu te adoro** | e-u te a-do-ru | Sana bayiliyorum |

<CultureTip title="Brezilya Sicakligi" flag="üáßüá∑">
Brezilyalilar duygularini acikca ifade etmekten cekinmezler. "Te amo" g√ºnl√ºk hayatta sik kullanilir. Brezilya'da sevgi g√∂sterileri - sarilmalar, √∂p√ºc√ºkler - cok normaldir ve tesvik edilir!
</CultureTip>

## G√ºnl√ºk Iletisim

### Sormak ve Cevaplamak

<VocabCard
  word="Como voc√™ est√°?"
  translation="Nasilsin?"
  pronunciation="ko-mu vo-se is-ta"
  example="Oi amor, como voc√™ est√°?"
/>

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Estou bem** | is-to bem | Iyiyim |
| **Mais ou menos** | mays o me-nus | S√∂yle b√∂yle |
| **N√£o estou muito bem** | n√£w is-to muy-tu bem | Pek iyi degilim |
| **O que houve?** | u ke o-ve | Ne oldu? |
| **Nada de especial** | na-da de es-pe-si-al | √ñzel bir sey yok |

### Izin ve Rica Etme

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Por favor** | pur fa-vor | L√ºtfen |
| **Obrigado/a** | ob-ri-ga-du/a | Tesekk√ºrler |
| **De nada** | de na-da | Rica ederim |
| **Desculpa** | des-kul-pa | √ñz√ºr dilerim |
| **N√£o tem problema** | n√£w tem pro-ble-ma | Sorun degil |

<VocabCard
  word="Posso te ajudar?"
  translation="Sana yardim edebilir miyim?"
  pronunciation="po-su te a-ju-dar"
  example="Voc√™ parece cansado. Posso te ajudar?"
/>

## Planlar ve √ñneriler

### Birlikte Plan Yapmak

<PhraseOfDay
  word="O que vamos fazer hoje √† noite?"
  translation="Bu aksam ne yapalim?"
  pronunciation="u ke va-mus fa-zer o-je a noy-te"
  context="Aksam planlari icin partnerinize sorun"
/>

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Vamos ao cinema?** | va-mus aw si-ne-ma | Sinemaya gidelim mi? |
| **Quer sair?** | ker sa-ir | Disari cikmak ister misin? |
| **Vamos ficar em casa** | va-mus fi-kar em ka-za | Evde kalalim |
| **O que voc√™ acha de...?** | u ke vo-se a-sha de | ...hakkinda ne d√ºs√ºn√ºyorsun? |
| **Boa ideia!** | bo-a i-dey-a | G√ºzel fikir! |

<VocabCard
  word="Quero passar tempo com voc√™"
  translation="Seninle vakit gecirmek istiyorum"
  pronunciation="ke-ru pa-sar tem-pu kom vo-se"
  example="Hoje s√≥ quero passar tempo com voc√™."
/>

## Yemek ve Mutfak

### Birlikte Yemek

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Estou com fome** | is-to kom fo-me | Aciktim |
| **O que voc√™ quer comer?** | u ke vo-se ker ko-mer | Ne yemek istersin? |
| **Eu cozinho hoje** | e-u ko-zi-nyu o-je | Bug√ºn ben pisiriyorum |
| **Est√° delicioso!** | is-ta de-li-si-o-zu | Cok lezzetli! |
| **Quer mais?** | ker mays | Daha ister misin? |

<CultureTip title="Brezilya Mutfagi" flag="üáßüá∑">
Brezilya'da yemek sosyal bir etkinliktir. √ñzellikle hafta sonlari ailece veya arkadaslarla uzun √∂gleler yemegi ("almo√ßo") yaygindir. Feijoada, p√£o de queijo ve aca√≠ en pop√ºler yiyecekler arasindadir.
</CultureTip>

## Duygulari Ifade Etme

### Mutluluk ve Memnuniyet

<VocabCard
  word="Estou feliz com voc√™"
  translation="Seninle mutluyum"
  pronunciation="is-to fe-lis kom vo-se"
  example="Voc√™ n√£o sabe como estou feliz com voc√™."
/>

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Voc√™ me faz feliz** | vo-se me faz fe-lis | Beni mutlu ediyorsun |
| **Estou muito contente** | is-to muy-tu kon-ten-te | Cok memnunum |
| **Que surpresa boa!** | ke sur-pre-za bo-a | Ne g√ºzel s√ºrpriz! |

### √úz√ºnt√º ve Destek

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **O que aconteceu?** | u ke a-kon-te-se-u | Ne oldu? |
| **Estou aqui para voc√™** | is-to a-ki pa-ra vo-se | Senin icin buradayim |
| **Vai ficar tudo bem** | vay fi-kar tu-du bem | Her sey iyi olacak |
| **Eu te entendo** | e-u te en-ten-du | Seni anliyorum |
| **N√£o se preocupe** | n√£w se pre-o-ku-pe | Endiselenme |

## Aksam ve Gece Ifadeleri

### Aksam Rutini

<VocabCard
  word="Como foi seu dia?"
  translation="G√ºn√ºn nasil gecti?"
  pronunciation="ko-mu foy se-u di-a"
  example="Oi amor, como foi seu dia?"
/>

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Estou cansado/a** | is-to kan-sa-du/a | Yorgunum |
| **Vamos relaxar** | va-mus he-lak-sar | Rahatlayelim |
| **Vamos assistir um filme?** | va-mus a-sis-tir um fil-me | Film izleyelim mi? |
| **Vem c√°** | vem ka | Buraya gel |

### Yatmadan √ñnce

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Boa noite, bons sonhos"
  translation="Iyi geceler, tatli r√ºyalar"
  pronunciation="bo-a noy-te, bons so-nyus"
  context="Her gece bu tatli ifadeyle vedalasin"
/>

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Est√° na hora de dormir** | is-ta na o-ra de dor-mir | Uyuma zamani |
| **Durma bem** | dur-ma bem | Iyi uyu |
| **Te amo, boa noite** | te a-mu, bo-a noy-te | Seni seviyorum, iyi geceler |
| **At√© amanh√£** | a-te a-ma-ny√£ | Yarina g√∂r√ºs√ºr√ºz |

## √ñzel Anlar Icin

### √ñvg√º ve Iltifat

<VocabCard
  word="Voc√™ √© a pessoa mais importante da minha vida"
  translation="Hayatimin en √∂nemli insanisin"
  pronunciation="vo-se e a pe-so-a mays im-por-tan-te da mi-nya vi-da"
  example="Voc√™ sabe que voc√™ √© a pessoa mais importante da minha vida?"
/>

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Voc√™ √© incr√≠vel** | vo-se e in-kri-vel | Inanilmazsin |
| **Voc√™ √© √∫nico/a** | vo-se e u-ni-ku/a | Essizsin |
| **Eu te admiro** | e-u te ad-mi-ru | Sana hayranim |
| **Tenho sorte de ter voc√™** | te-nyu sor-te de ter vo-se | Sana sahip oldugum icin sansliyim |

## Tartisma ve Baris

### Anlayis G√∂stermek

| Portekizce | Okunusu | T√ºrkce |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **Desculpa** | des-kul-pa | √ñz√ºr dilerim |
| **Voc√™ tem raz√£o** | vo-se tem ha-z√£w | Haklƒ±sin |
| **Me perdoa** | me per-do-a | Beni affet |
| **Vamos conversar** | va-mus kon-ver-sar | Konusalim |
| **Vamos fazer as pazes** | va-mus fa-zer as pa-zes | Baris yapalim |

<VocabCard
  word="N√£o queria te magoar"
  translation="Seni incitmek istemezdim"
  pronunciation="n√£w ke-ri-a te ma-go-ar"
  example="Desculpa, n√£o queria te magoar."
/>

Bu temel ifadeleri g√ºnl√ºk hayatinizda kullanarak, hem Portekizce becerilerinizi gelistirecek hem de partnerinizle iletisiminizi g√ºclendirecceksiniz. Unutmayin, her yeni ifade iliskinize yeni bir boyut katar!

## √ñƒürenmeye Devam Et

- **[Portekizce Telaffuz](/learn/tr/pt/portuguese-pronunciation-guide/)** - Sesleri √∂ƒürenin
- **[Temel Portekizce ƒ∞fadeler](/learn/tr/pt/portuguese-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - Pratik ileti≈üim
- **[Portekizce Zor mu?](/learn/tr/pt/is-portuguese-hard-to-learn/)** - D√ºr√ºst analiz
- **[Portekizce Selamla≈ümalar](/learn/tr/pt/portuguese-greetings-farewells/)** - Temel konu≈üma

<CTA text="Bu ifadeleri partnerinizle pratik yapƒ±n! Aile yemeƒüinde Dinleme Modunu kullanƒ±n, favorilerinizi Love Log'a kaydedin veya √∂ƒüretmeninizden sizin i√ßin meydan okumalar olu≈üturmasƒ±nƒ± isteyin." buttonText="Hemen Ba≈üla" />

articles.title: Incontrare la Famiglia del Tuo Partner: Frasi Olandesi per Fare una Grande Impressione
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Quel momento emozionante √® arrivato: finalmente incontrerai la famiglia del tuo partner olandese! Il primo incontro con i suoi cari pu√≤ far venire le farfalle nello stomaco, ma con le giuste frasi olandesi √® un po' di preparazione culturale, potrai creare subito una bella connessione. Questa guida ti aiuter√† a navigare con fiducia questo momento speciale della vostra storia d'amore.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Ik ben blij u te ontmoeten"
  translation="Sono felice di conoscerla"
  pronunciation="ik ben blay oo tuh on-MOO-ten"
  context="La frase pi√π importante per il primo incontro - la userai pi√π volte!"
/>

## Prima dell'Incontro: Prepararsi Culturalmente

I Paesi Bassi sono noti per la loro apertura e spontaneit√†, ma ci sono alcune norme sociali importanti da ricordare quando incontri i genitori olandesi per la prima volta.

<VocabCard
  word="Familie"
  translation="Famiglia"
  pronunciation="fah-MEE-lee-uh"
  example="Ik wil graag mijn familie aan je voorstellen."
/>

<CultureTip flag="üá≥üá±" title="Primi Contatti">
Gli olandesi apprezzano la sincerit√† √® la spontaneit√†. Non serve essere troppo formali - un semplice handdruk (stretta di mano) con contatto visivo √® un sorriso sincero √® perfetto. Le "tre baci" sulla guancia non sono tradizionali in Olanda, quindi aspetta di vedere come si muovono loro!
</CultureTip>

## Frasi Essenziali per il Primo Incontro

| Olandese | Pronuncia | Traduzione | Quando Usarla |
|----------|-----------|------------|---------------|
| **Goedendag** | CHOO-ten-dahg | Buongiorno | Saluto formale diurno |
| **Hallo, ik ben...** | HAH-loh, ik ben... | Ciao, io sono... | Presentarti |
| **Dank u wel** | dahnk oo vel | Grazie mille | Mostrare gratitudine |
| **Alsjeblieft** | AHL-shuh-bleeft | Per favore | Richieste educate |
| **Het spijt me** | het spayt muh | Mi dispiace | Scuse |
| **Ik spreek een beetje Nederlands** | ik sprayk un BAY-tjuh NAY-der-lahnts | Parlo un po' di olandese | Spiegare il tuo livello |
| **Kunt u dat uitleggen?** | kunt oo dat OWT-lay-ghen? | Pu√≤ spiegare? | Chiedere chiarimenti |
| **Wat een mooi huis!** | wat un mow hows | Che bella casa! | Fare un complimento |
| **Mag ik water?** | mahg ik VAH-ter? | Posso avere dell'acqua? | Chiedere qualcosa |
| **Ik voel me welkom** | ik fool muh vell-kohm | Mi sento benvenuto/a | Esprimere apprezzamento |

## Scenari Comuni Durante la Visita

### Arrivo a Casa Loro
Quando arrivi, usa sempre un saluto chiaro e presentati. I genitori olandesi apprezzeranno molto che tu faccia lo sforzo di parlare la loro lingua.

**Dialogo tipo:**
- **Genitore:** "Welkom! Ga zitten." (Benvenuto! Si accomodi.)
- **Tu:** "Dank u wel, het is fijn hier te zijn." (Grazie mille, √® bello essere qui.)

### A Cena con la Famiglia
La cena √® spesso il momento centrale dell'incontro. Ecco alcune frasi utili per i pasti in famiglia.

<VocabCard
  word="Eet smakelijk"
  translation="Buon appetito"
  pronunciation="ayt SMAH-kuh-luk"
  example="Eet smakelijk, iedereen!"
/>

<CultureTip flag="üá≥üá±" title="Etichetta a Tavola">
In Olanda √® normale offrire da bere agli ospiti appena arrivano. Se ti offrono qualcosa, √® educato accettare almeno un bicchiere d'acqua. Dire "nee" subito pu√≤ sembrare scortese!
</CultureTip>

### Mostrare Interesse per la Famiglia
I genitori olandesi amano parlare dei loro figli e della loro famiglia. Mostra interesse con queste domande gentili:

- **Heeft u nog andere kinderen?** (Ha altri figli?)
- **Wat doet u voor de kost?** (Che lavoro fa?)
- **Hoe lang woont u hier al?** (Da quanto tempo vive qui?)
- **Wat zijn uw hobby's?** (Quali sono i suoi hobby?)

## Vocabolario per Conversazioni di Base

| Categoria | Olandese | Pronuncia | Traduzione |
|-----------|----------|-----------|------------|
| **Famiglia** | Ouders | OW-ders | Genitori |
| | Broer | broor | Fratello |
| | Zus | zuhs | Sorella |
| | Opa | OH-pah | Nonno |
| | Oma | OH-mah | Nonna |
| **Complimenti** | Lief | leaf | Carino/a |
| | Aardig | AHR-dikh | Gentile |
| | Gezellig | khuh-ZELL-ukh | Accogliente/cordiale |
| | Interessant | in-ter-uh-SAHNT | Interessante |
| **Domande** | Waar kom je vandaan? | vahr kohn yuh fahn-DAHN? | Di dove sei? |
| | Wat doe je? | vat doo yuh? | Che fai nella vita? |
| | Hoe oud ben je? | hoo owt ben yuh? | Quanti anni hai? |

## Frasi per Rendere l'Atmosfera Pi√π Calda

<VocabCard
  word="Ik hou van uw zoon/dochter"
  translation="Amo vostro figlio/vostra figlia"
  pronunciation="ik how vahn oo zohn/DOH-khter"
  example="Ik hou van uw dochter, ze is geweldig."
/>

Per creare una connessione emotiva con la famiglia del tuo partner, usa queste frasi sincere:

- **Uw kind maakt me zo gelukkig** (Vostro figlio/mi fa cos√¨ felice)
- **Ik wil uw cultuur beter leren kennen** (Voglio conoscere meglio la vostra cultura)
- **Dank u dat u mij verwelkomt** (Grazie per avermi accolto/a)
- **Het is een eer bij uw familie te zijn** (√à un onore essere con la vostra famiglia)

## Gestire le Domande Difficili

A volte i genitori possono fare domande personali. Ecco come rispondere con diplomazia:

| Situazione | Frase Olandese | Pronuncia | Significato |
|------------|----------------|-----------|-------------|
| **Futuro insieme** | "We nemen het rustig aan" | vuh NAY-mun ut ruhs-tikh ahn | "Stiamo andando piano" |
| **Matrimonio** | "Daar praten we nog over" | DAHR PRAH-tun vuh nok OH-vun | "Ne parleremo ancora" |
| **Lavoro** | "Ik werk in... en ik vind het leuk" | ik verku in... en ik fint ut layk | "Lavoro in... e mi piace" |
| **Apprendimento olandese** | "Ik leer Nederlands voor hem/haar" | ik layr NAY-der-lahnts voor hum/hahr | "Studio olandese per lui/lei" |

## Se le Cose Non Vanno Come Previsto

Non preoccuparti se non capisci tutto! Ecco le frasi salvavita:

<VocabCard
  word="Kunt u wat langzamer praten?"
  translation="Pu√≤ parlare pi√π lentamente?"
  pronunciation="kunt oo vat LAHNZ-sah-mer PRAH-tun?"
  example="Sorry, kunt u wat langzamer praten?"
/>

- **Ik begrijp het niet** (Non capisco)
- **Kunt u herhalen?** (Pu√≤ ripetere?)
- **Sorry, mijn Nederlands is niet perfect** (Scusi, il mio olandese non √® perfetto)
- **Mag ik even nadenken?** (Posso pensarci un momento?)

<CultureTip flag="üá≥üá±" title="Umorismo Olandese">
Gli olandesi amano l'autoscherzo! Se commetti un errore linguistico, ridere di te stesso/a mostrer√† fiducia. Dire qualcosa come "Mijn Nederlands klinkt vast grappig!" (Il mio olandese suona sicuramente divertente!) romper√† il ghiaccio immediatamente.
</CultureTip>

## Consigli per Colpire nel Segno

1. **Porta un piccolo regalo**: I fiori o una specialit√† italiana sono sempre apprezzati. Usa: "Dit is een cadeautje uit Itali√´" (Questo √® un regalo dall'Italia).

2. **Mostra interesse per la loro cultura**: Chiedi consigli su cosa visitare in Olanda. Leggi anche la nostra guida sulle [frasi romantiche olandesi per ogni occasione](/learn/it/nl/dutch-romantic-phrases-every-occasion/) per impressionare ulteriormente.

3. **Condividi la tua cultura**: I genitori olandesi amano apprendere cose nuove. Porta una foto della tua famiglia e spiega chi √® chi.

4. **Aiuta con i piatti**: Offrirti di aiutare a sparecchiare mostra rispetto. D√¨: "Mag ik helpen afwassen?" (Posso aiutare a lavare i piatti?)

5. **Scatta foto insieme**: Chiedi: "Mogen we een foto maken?" (Possiamo fare una foto?) - sar√† un ricordo prezioso per tutti.

6. **Impara i [saluti e presentazioni in olandese](/learn/it/nl/dutch-greetings-farewells/)**: Una buona prima impressione inizia con un saluto appropriato.

7. **Porta il tuo entusiasmo**: I fatti contano, ma l'atteggiamento ancora di pi√π. Mostra quanto tieni al loro figlio/a!

## Scheda di Riferimento Rapido

**Screenshot queste 10 frase essenziali:**

1. **Goedendag, ik ben [nome]** - Buongiorno, sono [nome]
2. **Dank u wel voor het welkom** - Grazie per il benvenuto
3. **Uw zoon/dochter is geweldig** - Vostro figlio/figlia √® fantastico/a
4. **Mag ik wat water?** - Posso avere dell'acqua?
5. **Eet smakelijk!** - Buon appetito!
6. **Ik hou ook van [attivit√†]** - Anch'io amo [attivit√†]
7. **Wat een gezellig huis!** - Che casa accogliente!
8. **Kunt u me helpen?** - Mi pu√≤ aiutare?
9. **Tot ziens!** - Arrivederci!
10. **Bedankt voor alles!** - Grazie di tutto!

Ricordati: i genitori del tuo partner vogliono solo vedere che fai felice il loro figlio/a. Con un po' di preparazione linguistica e tanto amore sincero, questo primo incontro sar√† l'inizio di una bellissima relazione con la tua nuova famiglia olandese!

<CTA />

articles.title: 50 Ukrainske K√¶rlighedsudtryk Enhver Par B√∏r Kende
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

N√•r du el√¶rer ukrainsk for din partner, handler det ikke kun om grammatik og ordforr√•d - det handler om at skabe en dybere forbindelse gennem sprog. Disse 50 essentielle k√¶rlighedsudtryk vil hj√¶lpe jer med at udtrykke jeres f√∏lelser p√• ukrainsk, fra hverdagens s√∏de bem√¶rkninger til de mest romantiske √∏jeblikke. Hvis du vil starte med det allervigtigste, kan du l√¶se vores guide til [sige jeg elsker dig p√• ukrainsk](/learn/da/uk/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-ukrainian/).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="–Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é"
  translation="Jeg elsker dig"
  pronunciation="jah teh-beh koh-HAH-yoo"
  context="Den mest essentielle s√¶tning - brug den dagligt med din partner"
/>

## De Fundamentale 10: K√¶rlighedens Byggesten

Disse ti fraser danner fundamentet for romantisk kommunikation p√• ukrainsk. √òv dem sammen, indtil de sidder p√• rygraden!

<VocabCard
  word="–ö–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è"
  translation="K√¶rlighed"
  pronunciation="koh-HAHN-nyah"
  example="–ù–∞—à–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è –æ—Å–æ–±–ª–∏–≤–µ - Vores k√¶rlighed er speciel"
/>

| Ukrainsk | Dansk | Udtale | Hvorn√•r bruges |
|----------|--------|----------|------------------|
| **–Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é** | Jeg elsker dig | jah teh-beh koh-HAH-yoo | Hver dag, n√•r som helst |
| **–¢–∏ –º–µ–Ω—ñ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–∞—î—à—Å—è** | Jeg kan lide dig | tih meh-NEE poh-doh-BAH-yesh-syah | N√•r I l√¶rer hinanden at kende |
| **–¢–∏ –º–æ—î —â–∞—Å—Ç—è** | Du er min lykke | tih moh-yeh SHCHAH-styah | Romantiske √∏jeblikke |
| **–ú–æ—è –ª—é–±–æ–≤** | Min k√¶rlighed | moh-yah lyoo-BOHV | N√•r du taler om jeres k√¶rlighed |
| **–¢–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–∞** | Du er smuk (til hende) | tih preh-KRAHS-nah | Komplimenter |
| **–¢–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–∏–π** | Du er smuk (til ham) | tih preh-KRAHS-nee | Komplimenter |
| **–Ø —Å—É–º—É—é –∑–∞ —Ç–æ–±–æ—é** | Jeg savner dig | jah soo-MOO-yoo zah toh-BOH-yoo | N√•r I er adskilt |
| **–¢–∏ –º–æ—î —Å–æ–Ω—Ü–µ** | Du er min sol | tih moh-yeh SOHN-tseh | S√∏de k√¶lenavne |
| **–ó —Ç–æ–±–æ—é –¥–æ–±—Ä–µ** | Det er dejligt med dig | z toh-BOH-yoo DOHB-reh | Komfort og tryghed |
| **–Ø —â–∞—Å–ª–∏–≤–∏–π –∑ —Ç–æ–±–æ—é** | Jeg er lykkelig med dig | jah SHCHAH-slee-veech z toh-BOH-yoo | Livsgl√¶de og tilfredshed |

## S√∏de K√¶lenavne og √ògenavne

Ukrainerne elsker kreative k√¶lenavne! Brug dem til at g√∏re jeres samtaler mere personlige og k√¶rlige. For flere s√∏de navne, tjek vores [guide til ukrainske k√¶lenavne](/learn/da/uk/ukrainian-pet-names-for-your-partner/).

<CultureTip flag="üá∫üá¶" title="K√¶lenavne Kultur">
Ukrainske par bruger ofte dyreinspirerede k√¶lenavne som "–∫–æ—Ç–∏–∫" (kat) eller "–∑–∞–π—á–∏–∫" (kanin). Det er en s√∏d m√•de at vise k√¶rlighed p√•!
</CultureTip>

<VocabCard
  word="–ö–æ—Ç–∏–∫—É"
  translation="Min kat (k√¶lenavn)"
  pronunciation="KOH-tee-koo"
  example="–ü—Ä–∏–≤—ñ—Ç, –∫–æ—Ç–∏–∫—É, —è–∫ —Ç–≤—ñ–π –¥–µ–Ω—å?"
/>

| Ukrainsk | Dansk | Udtale | Type |
|----------|--------|----------|------|
| **–ö–æ—Ç–∏–∫** | Kat (k√¶lenavn) | KOH-tik | Dyreinspireret |
| **–ó–∞–π—á–∏–∫** | Kanin (k√¶lenavn) | ZAH-ee-chik | Dyreinspireret |
| **–°–æ–Ω–µ—á–∫–æ** | Solskin | SOH-neh-chkoh | Naturinspireret |
| **–†–∏–±–∫–æ** | Fisk | RIB-koh | Dyreinspireret |
| **–ú–µ–¥** | Honning | mehd | Mad-inspireret |
| **–¶—É–∫–µ—Ä–∫–æ** | Slik | tsoo-KEHR-koh | Mad-inspireret |
| **–ö–≤—ñ—Ç–æ—á–∫–æ** | Blomst | KVEE-toh-chkoh | Naturinspireret |
| **–ó—ñ—Ä–æ—á–∫–æ** | Stjerne | ZEE-roh-chkoh | Naturinspireret |

## Komplimenter og Beundring

L√¶r at give komplimenter p√• ukrainsk - det vil g√∏re din partners dag lysere!

- **–¢–∏ —Ç–∞–∫–∞ –≥–∞—Ä–Ω–∞** (Du er s√• smuk) - tih TAH-kah HAR-nah
- **–ú–µ–Ω—ñ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–∞—î—Ç—å—Å—è —Ç–≤–æ—è –ø–æ—Å–º—ñ—à–∫–∞** (Jeg kan lide dit smil) - meh-NEE poh-doh-BAH-yeh-tsyah TVOH-yah POHS-mee-shkah
- **–¢–∏ —Ä–æ–∑—É–º–Ω–∞** (Du er klog) - tih roh-ZOOM-nah
- **–¢–∏ —Å–º—ñ—à–Ω–∞** (Du er sjov) - tih SMEESH-nah
- **–£ —Ç–µ–±–µ –≥–∞—Ä–Ω—ñ –æ—á—ñ** (Du har smukke √∏jne) - oo teh-beh HAR-nee OH-chee

## Hverdagens K√¶rlighed

Disse fraser bruger I i jeres daglige liv sammen:

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á, –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–π"
  translation="Godnat, min elskede"
  pronunciation="doh-BRAH-neech koh-HAH-nee"
  example="–î–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ—á, –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–π, —Å–æ–ª–æ–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω—ñ–≤!"
/>

| Ukrainsk | Dansk | Udtale | Brug |
|----------|--------|----------|------|
| **–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–Ω–∫—É** | Godmorgen | DOHB-roh-hoh RAHN-koo | V√•gn sammen |
| **–°–æ–ª–æ–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω—ñ–≤** | S√∏de dr√∏mme | SOH-loht-kih sniv | Ved sengetid |
| **–ì–∞—Ä–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è** | Hav en god dag | HAR-noh-hoh dnyah | N√•r I skilles |
| **–ë—É–¥—å –æ–±–µ—Ä–µ–∂–Ω–∏–º** | V√¶r forsigtig | boot oh-beh-REZH-neem | N√•r partneren tager af sted |
| **–ù–µ —Ö–≤–∏–ª—é–π—Å—è** | V√¶r ikke bekymret | neh khvee-LYOO-ee-syah | Tr√∏st |
| **–Ø –ø–∏—à–∞—é—Å—è —Ç–æ–±–æ—é** | Jeg er stolt af dig | jah pee-SHAH-yoo-syah toh-BOH-yoo | St√∏tte |

## Romantiske √òjeblikke

Til de s√¶rlige stunder, hvor kun det mest romantiske sprog vil g√∏re:

<CultureTip flag="üá∫üá¶" title="Romantiske Traditioner">
Ukrainere er meget poetiske i deres k√¶rlighedserkl√¶ringer. Brug gerne metaforer fra naturen - stjerner, m√•ne, hav - det anses for meget romantisk!
</CultureTip>

- **–¢–∏ –º–æ—è –∑—ñ—Ä–∫–∞** (Du er min stjerne) - tih moh-yah ZEER-kah
- **–ë–µ–∑ —Ç–µ–±–µ —è –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂—É –∂–∏—Ç–∏** (Jeg kan ikke leve uden dig) - behz teh-beh yah neh MOH-zhoo ZHEE-tee
- **–¢–∏ –º–æ—î –≤—Å–µ** (Du er mit alt) - tih moh-yeh fsyeh
- **–ù–∞—à–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è –≤—ñ—á–Ω–µ** (Vores k√¶rlighed er evig) - NAH-sheh koh-HAHN-nyah VEETCH-neh
- **–¢–∏ –º—ñ–π –∞–Ω–≥–µ–ª** (Du er min engel) - tih meech AHN-hehl

## S√•dan Bruger I Det Sammen

### Tips til Par
1. **√òv dagligt**: V√¶lg 3-5 nye fraser hver uge og brug dem aktivt
2. **Skriv k√¶rlighedsbreve**: Brug de nye fraser i h√•ndskrevne beskeder
3. **Telefonbeskeder**: Send s√∏de ukrainske beskeder gennem dagen
4. **Fejl er okay**: Din partner vil elske, at du pr√∏ver - perfektion er ikke m√•let

### Almindelige Fejl at Undg√•
- **V√¶r opm√¶rksom p√• k√∏n**: Brug de rigtige endelser (-–Ω–∞ for kvinder, -–Ω–∏–π for m√¶nd)
- **Kontekst er vigtig**: Nogle fraser er kun for private √∏jeblikke
- **Udtale √∏ver**: Tag tid til at l√¶re den rigtige udtale - det viser respekt

For mere hj√¶lp til jeres sprogl√¶ringsrejse, kan I l√¶se vores guide til [essentielle ukrainske fraser for par](/learn/da/uk/essential-ukrainian-phrases-for-couples/).

At l√¶re ukrainsk sammen er mere end blot at mestere nye ord - det er at bygge bro mellem jeres hjerter gennem et nyt sprog. Start med disse k√¶rlighedsudtryk, og I vil opdage, hvordan selv de simpleste fraser kan b√¶re dybe f√∏lelser. Hver gang du siger "–Ø —Ç–µ–±–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é" til din partner, skaber I ikke bare en s√¶tning - I skaber et √∏jeblik af ren k√¶rlighed.
